verses.kjv: And Abraham journeyed from thence toward the south country, and dwelled between Kadesh and Shur, and sojourned in Gerar.
verses.ct: Abraham moved on from there toward the southern region and settled between Kadesh and Shur, living for a time in Gerar.

verses.kjv: And Abraham said of Sarah his wife, She is my sister: and Abimelech king of Gerar sent, and took Sarah.
verses.ct: Abraham told people that Sarah his wife was his sister. So Abimelech, king of Gerar, sent for Sarah and took her.

verses.kjv: But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night, and said to him, Behold, thou art but a dead man, for the woman which thou hast taken; for she is a man’s wife.
verses.ct: But God came to Abimelech in a dream that night and said to him, "You are as good as dead because of the woman you have taken — she is a married woman."

verses.kjv: But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, LORD, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?
verses.ct: Now Abimelech had not touched her, so he said, "Lord, would you destroy an innocent nation?"

verses.kjv: Said he not unto me, She is my sister? and she, even she herself said, He is my brother: in the integrity of my heart and innocency of my hands have I done this.
verses.ct: "He himself told me, 'She is my sister,' and she also confirmed it, saying, 'He is my brother.' I did this with a clear conscience and clean hands."

verses.kjv: And God said unto him in a dream, Yea, I know that thou didst this in the integrity of thy heart; for I also withheld thee from sinning against me: therefore suffered I thee not to touch her.
verses.ct: God said to him in the dream, "Yes, I know you did this with a clear conscience. In fact, I am the one who kept you from sinning against me — that is why I did not let you touch her."

verses.kjv: Now therefore restore the man his wife; for he is a prophet, and he shall pray for thee, and thou shalt live: and if thou restore her not, know thou that thou shalt surely die, thou, and all that are thine.
verses.ct: "So now, return the man's wife to him. He is a prophet, and he will pray for you, and you will live. But if you do not return her, understand that you will certainly die — you and everyone who belongs to you."

verses.kjv: Therefore Abimelech rose early in the morning, and called all his servants, and told all these things in their ears: and the men were sore afraid.
verses.ct: Abimelech got up early the next morning, summoned all his servants, and told them everything that had happened. The men were terrified.

verses.kjv: Then Abimelech called Abraham, and said unto him, What hast thou done unto us? and what have I offended thee, that thou hast brought on me and on my kingdom a great sin? thou hast done deeds unto me that ought not to be done.
verses.ct: Then Abimelech called for Abraham and demanded, "What have you done to us? How did I wrong you that you would bring such serious sin on me and my kingdom? You have done things to me that should never be done."

verses.kjv: And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What sawest thou, that thou hast done this thing?
verses.ct: Abimelech also asked Abraham, "What were you thinking when you did this?"

verses.kjv: And Abraham said, Because I thought, Surely the fear of God is not in this place; and they will slay me for my wife’s sake.
verses.ct: Abraham replied, "I thought, 'Surely there is no reverence for God in this place, and they will kill me to get my wife.'"

verses.kjv: And yet indeed she is my sister; she is the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother; and she became my wife.
verses.ct: "Besides, she really is my sister — she is my father's daughter, though not my mother's daughter — and she became my wife."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when God caused me to wander from my father’s house, that I said unto her, This is thy kindness which thou shalt shew unto me; at every place whither we shall come, say of me, He is my brother.
verses.ct: "When God led me to leave my father's household and travel from place to place, I said to her, 'Here is how you can show your loyalty to me: everywhere we go, tell people about me, "He is my brother."'"

verses.kjv: And Abimelech took sheep, and oxen, and menservants, and womenservants, and gave them unto Abraham, and restored him Sarah his wife.
verses.ct: So Abimelech brought sheep, cattle, male servants, and female servants and gave them to Abraham. He also returned his wife Sarah to him.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech said, Behold, my land is before thee: dwell where it pleaseth thee.
verses.ct: Abimelech said, "Look, my land is open to you — settle wherever you like."

verses.kjv: And unto Sarah he said, Behold, I have given thy brother a thousand pieces of silver: behold, he is to thee a covering of the eyes, unto all that are with thee, and with all other: thus she was reproved.
verses.ct: To Sarah he said, "I am giving your brother 1,000 pieces of silver. This settles the matter and clears your reputation before everyone who is with you and before all people." In this way she was vindicated.

verses.kjv: So Abraham prayed unto God: and God healed Abimelech, and his wife, and his maidservants; and they bare children.
verses.ct: Then Abraham prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech, his wife, and his female servants so that they could have children again.

verses.kjv: For the LORD had fast closed up all the wombs of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah Abraham’s wife.
verses.ct: For the LORD had completely prevented anyone in Abimelech's household from becoming pregnant, because of Sarah, Abraham's wife.
